items.content: Every year, 2.3 million newborns don’t survive their first 28 days. But simple, low-cost interventions that identify risks early, improve prenatal care, and help mothers survive delivery can give more of these babies a fighting chance.

article.title: The Gates Foundation's biggest breakthrough | Bill Gates
article.subtitle: gatesnotes.com
article.linkLabel: Open article: The Gates Foundation's biggest breakthrough | Bill Gates by gatesnot.es

items.content: The leading causes of childhood death reveal a stark truth: Many could be prevented, and children in poor countries die from them far more often than those in wealthy ones. We have the tools to save lives—and by helping them reach the right children at the right time, the world has cut global child deaths by more than half—from 12 million in 1990 to 4.6 million in 2021. It’s extraordinary progress, but the work isn’t over: https://lnkd.in/gC4pEPsW

author.name: Bill Gates
author.info: Chair, Gates Foundation and Founder, Breakthrough Energy

postedAt.postedAgoText: 6 days ago • Visible to anyone on or off LinkedIn

document.title: How better data helped us cut child mortality in half

items.content: Even as the number of children born every year has gone up, the number of childhood deaths has fallen by more than half—from 11.3 million in 1990 to 4.5 million in 2022. Playing a part in making that happen is the best job I’ve ever had, and the most meaningful work I’ve ever done.

article.title: The breakthrough that transformed the Gates Foundation

article.linkLabel: Open article: The breakthrough that transformed the Gates Foundation by Bill Gates • 6 min read
article.description: We started the Gates Foundation 25 years ago to save and improve children’s lives. But no one can solve a problem they don’t fully understand. And bac

items.content:
The foundation’s annual employee meeting is always one of my favorite days of the year. This was my first time seeing everyone since I announced that I will give away virtually all of my wealth through the Gates Foundation over the next 20 years to save and improve lives around the world. ​

I feel confident putting the remainder of my wealth into the foundation, because I know how brilliant and dedicated the people responsible for using that money are—and it was wonderful getting a chance to celebrate them. https://lnkd.in/gRVnA-vx

author.info: Chair, Gates Foundation and Founder, Breakthrough Energy

items.content: Today marks the beginning of the last chapter of my career. I have come a long way since I was just a kid starting a software company with my friend from middle school, and I look forward to giving away virtually all of the wealth I earned through Microsoft. The Gates Foundation will use these resources over the next 20 years to double down on our efforts to save and improve lives around the world.

items.content: No mother or child should die from a preventable cause. No generation should live in fear of deadly infectious disease. And no one should be denied the chance to thrive because of where they were born. There have never been more opportunities to help people live healthier, more prosperous lives, and I’m accelerating my giving to make the most of them. https://lnkd.in/ggy-uF9d

Every time I’m with Warren, I’m reminded how lucky I am to know him—not just as one of the greatest investors and philanthropists of all time, but as a mentor and a friend. My life changed the day we met. I’ve learned so much from his integrity, humor, and generosity. Congratulations, Warren.

article.title: The Drone Didis are taking flight in India | Bill Gates
article.subtitle: gatesnotes.com
article.linkLabel: Open article: The Drone Didis are taking flight in India | Bill Gates by gatesnot.es

items.content:
I’m heading to Singapore next week—a hub for innovation that is shaping the future. ​
​
There, I’ll join the Philanthropy Asia Summit to talk about the role philanthropy can play in scaling solutions to global challenges. I'll also be attending Ecosperity Week to discuss how investing in energy innovation—and in the entrepreneurs driving it—can help grow the global economy while reducing emissions. And I’m especially excited to meet young changemakers at ATxInspire, where we’ll explore how technology can be a force for good. ​
​
Across Southeast Asia, we’re seeing what’s possible when people work together to solve tough problems—from maternal and child health to digital public infrastructure to climate breakthroughs. I’m looking forward to learning, listening, and being part of the conversation.

author.name: Bill Gates
author.info: Chair, Gates Foundation and Founder, Breakthrough Energy
